instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.KERNEL_TASK: What is KERNEL_TASK? KERNEL_TASK is a process that will take up all the CPU and cause the macbook to run very slow when there is a sensor issue. When you see KERNEL_TASK as a process taking up lots of CPU and the machine is working very slow or has loud fans, use a program like hwmonitor to check voltage, amperage, and temperature sensors and look for something that doesn’t look right..
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15” Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: [SOLVED]GPU Panic: mux-regs
threads.message:
[SIZE=18px][B]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/B][/SIZE]

No liquid, no visible damage.
ASD reports nothing.

threads.title: [SOLVED]GPU Panic: mux-regs
threads.message: What year is this and what is the board # ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]GPU Panic: mux-regs
threads.message:
[QUOTE="jgraffis, post: 21231"]What year is this and what is the board # ?[/QUOTE]

Oh shit..... <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

threads.title: [SOLVED]GPU Panic: mux-regs
threads.message: Surround <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> in flux, use a micropencil and fresh solder to resolder all of the pins. Then use a little bit of hot air to reflow the surrounding area.

threads.title: [SOLVED]GPU Panic: mux-regs
threads.message:
[QUOTE="larossmann, post: 21251"]Surround <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> in flux, use a micropencil and fresh solder to resolder all of the pins. Then use a little bit of hot air to reflow the surrounding area.[/QUOTE]

So it's likely the <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> thing... Went to re-read the sticky but it was gone.
Cheers Louis, I'll post back.

threads.title: [SOLVED]GPU Panic: mux-regs
threads.message:
I've touched up <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> and reflowed everything in the area.
Not getting any panic running Furmark now. Ran it until the machine got hotter than I'm comfortable with.

I think it's solved.

threads.title: [SOLVED]GPU Panic: mux-regs
threads.message: <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> has nothing to do with temperature. The crashes happen when the machine is flexed, bumped, etc.

threads.title: [SOLVED]GPU Panic: mux-regs
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 21321"]<CHIP>U8900</CHIP> has nothing to do with temperature. [/QUOTE]

I know it's nothng to do with temprature. Ran FurMark to switch to GFX to see if switching caused a KP.

[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 21321"]The crashes happen when the machine is flexed, bumped, etc.[/QUOTE]

Because of bad solder joints.... OK I'll bend it and bash it about
